data.name: kASLR_Leak
data.description:
pwnyOS supports link-time kASLR, so the kernel could be located pretty much anywhere. However, the kernel is leaking its virtual base address. 

Leak the kASLR slide, and call syscall 14 with the slide as the first argument for your flag.

(Hint: you're looking for a 4MB aligned address exposed by the kernel.)

Author: ravi
